etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin, literally ‘cone-bearing’, from conus (see cone)

definitions: a tree that bears cones and needle-like or scale-like leaves that are typically evergreen. Conifers are of major importance as the source of softwood, and also supply resins and turpentine.

notes.text: Order Coniferales, class Coniferopsida, subdivision Gymnospermae: several families, including the pines and firs (Pinaceae) and the cypresses (Cupressaceae)

shortDefinitions: tree which bears cones and needle-like or scale-like leaves
